interview_questions.question: What is the basic syntax for writing an HTML comment?
interview_questions.answer:
An HTML comment starts with `<!--` and ends with `-->`. Example:

```html
<!-- This is a comment -->
```
interview_questions.explanation: Comments are ignored by the browser and are not displayed on the page.

interview_questions.question: Can HTML comments be placed anywhere in a document?
interview_questions.answer: Yes, comments can be placed almost anywhere in HTML, except inside tag names or attribute values.
interview_questions.explanation: Placing comments inside elements, between elements, or before the doctype is valid, but not inside attribute values.

interview_questions.question: How do browsers treat content inside HTML comments?
interview_questions.answer: Browsers ignore the content inside comments, so it is not rendered or displayed to users.
interview_questions.explanation: Comments are used for documentation and are not part of the visible page.

interview_questions.question: Can HTML comments be used to 'hide' code? Give an example.
interview_questions.answer:
Yes, you can temporarily disable code by commenting it out: ```html

This is visible

```
interview_questions.explanation: This is useful for debugging or removing code without deleting it permanently.

interview_questions.question: Is it possible to nest HTML comments?
interview_questions.answer: No, HTML does not support nested comments. The first closing `-->` ends the comment.
interview_questions.explanation: Attempting to nest comments can result in unexpected rendering or ignored code.

interview_questions.question: Can comments appear inside HTML tags or attributes?
interview_questions.answer: No, comments cannot be placed inside tag names or attribute values. This will break the HTML.
interview_questions.explanation: For example, `<a <!-- comment --> href="url">` is invalid syntax.

interview_questions.question: How are multiline comments written in HTML?
interview_questions.answer:
Use a single opening `<!--` and closing `-->`, with content spanning multiple lines:

```html
<!--
This is a multiline
HTML comment
-->
```
interview_questions.explanation: There is no separate syntax for multiline comments; just place line breaks inside the comment.

interview_questions.question: Do HTML comments affect the performance or size of the final rendered page?
interview_questions.answer: Comments increase the size of the HTML sent to the browser, but they are ignored during rendering. Excessive comments can slightly increase load time.
interview_questions.explanation: It's good practice to remove unnecessary comments from production code to reduce file size.

interview_questions.question: Are comments visible to users in the browser?
interview_questions.answer: No, comments are not visible on the rendered page, but they can be seen by viewing the page source.
interview_questions.explanation: Anyone can see comments by right-clicking and selecting 'View Page Source' in the browser.

interview_questions.question: Why are comments important in HTML code?
interview_questions.answer: Comments help explain the structure, purpose, or logic of the code for yourself and other developers who read it later.
interview_questions.explanation: Well-commented code is easier to maintain, debug, and collaborate on.
